intro: Rondonanthus capillaceus, commonly known as the silky rondonanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
